title: Opinion Writing: Arguments and Evidence

vocab.kid_friendly_definition: A personal belief or feeling about something that cannot be proven right or wrong.
A statement that can be proven to be true.
Facts, examples, and reasons that support an opinion.
The main point or opinion you are trying to prove.
A statement that explains why your opinion makes sense.
The ending that sums up your opinion and reasons.
Writing that tries to convince someone to agree with you.
A specific fact or story that backs up your reason.
A reason that goes against your opinion that you can address.

teachingNotes: Teach students the OREO method for opinion writing: State your Opinion, provide a Reason, give an Example (evidence), and restate your Opinion. This provides a clear, memorable structure for building an argument.
